## Functions

### alignToARMConstant() {#a0bf132fca1d70790323a51a61f306321}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static uint32&#95;t alignToARMConstant (uint32&#95;t Value)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Get the minimum constant for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a> that is greater than or equal to the argument.

In <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a>, constants can have any value that can be produced by rotating an 8-bit value to the right by an even number of bits within a 32-bit word.

Definition at line <a href="#l03102">3102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>
Emit an instruction sequence that will align the address in register Reg by zero-ing out the lower bits.

For versions of the architecture that support Neon, this must be done in a single instruction, since skipAlignedDPRCS2Spills assumes it is done in a single instruction. That function only gets called when optimizing spilling of D registers on a core with the Neon instruction set present.

### getMaxFPOffset() {#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static int getMaxFPOffset (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget">ARMSubtarget</a> &amp; STI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo">ARMFunctionInfo</a> &amp; AFI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
We need the offset of the frame pointer relative to other <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> offsets which are encoded relative to SP at function begin.

See also emitPrologue() for how the FP is set up. Unfortunately we cannot determine this value in determineCalleeSaves() yet as <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/prologepiloginserter-cpp/#abde55543f0bbb31306a6cd2af297fe9f">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> hasn&#39;t run at this point. Instead we use this to produce a conservative estimate that we check in an <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert()</a> later.

<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// After the prologue has run, the frame has the following general structure.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Technically the last frame area (VLAs) doesn&#39;t get created until in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// main function body, after the prologue is run. However, it&#39;s depicted here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for completeness.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   | Higher address</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | arguments passed on the stack     |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- (sp at function entry)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | varargs from registers            |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | prev&#95;lr                           |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | prev&#95;fp                           |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | (a.k.a. &quot;frame record&quot;)           |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -| &lt;- fp (r7 or r11)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | callee-saved gpr registers        |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | callee-saved fp/simd regs         |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |.empty.space.to.make.part.below....|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |.aligned.in.case.it.needs.more.than| (size of this area is unknown at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |.the.standard.8-byte.alignment.....|  compile time; if present)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | local variables of fixed size     |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | including spill slots             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- base pointer (not defined by ABI,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |.variable-sized.local.variables....|       LLVM chooses r6)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |.(VLAs)............................| (size of this area is unknown at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |...................................|  compile time)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- sp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |                                   | Lower address</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To access the data in a frame, at-compile time, a constant offset must be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computable from one of the pointers (fp, bp, sp) to access it. The size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the areas with a dotted background cannot be computed at compile-time</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if they are present, making it required to have all three of fp, bp and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sp to be set up to be able to access all contents in the frame areas,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// assuming all of the frame areas are non-empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For most functions, some of the frame areas are empty. For those functions,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it may not be necessary to set up fp or bp:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42; A base pointer is definitely needed when there are both VLAs and local</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   variables with more-than-default alignment requirements.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42; A frame pointer is definitely needed when there are local variables with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   more-than-default alignment requirements.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In some cases when a base pointer is not strictly needed, it is generated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// anyway when offsets from the frame pointer to access local variables become</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so large that the offset can&#39;t be encoded in the immediate fields of loads</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or stores.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The frame pointer might be chosen to be r7 or r11, depending on the target</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// architecture and operating system. See ARMSubtarget::getFramePointerReg for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// details.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Outgoing function arguments must be at the bottom of the stack frame when</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// calling another function. If we do not have variable-sized stack objects, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can allocate a &quot;reserved call frame&quot; area at the bottom of the local</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variable area, large enough for all outgoing calls. If we do have VLAs, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the stack pointer must be decremented and incremented around each call to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// make space for the arguments below the VLAs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">/// hasReservedCallFrame - Under normal circumstances, when a frame pointer is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">/// not required, we reserve argument space for call sites in the function</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CFSize = MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a4f335273c28b17552a7cfd802f42be2a">getMaxCallFrameSize</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s not always a good idea to include the call frame as part of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack frame. ARM (especially Thumb) has small immediate offset to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address the stack frame. So a large call frame can cause poor codegen</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and may even makes it impossible to scavenge a register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CFSize &gt;= ((1 &lt;&lt; 12) - 1) / 2)  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Half of imm12</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="comment">/// canSimplifyCallFramePseudos - If there is a reserved call frame, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="comment">/// call frame pseudos can be simplified.  Unlike most targets, having a FP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is not sufficient here since we still may reference some objects via SP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="comment">/// even when FP is available in Thumb2 mode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// epilogue. For the C calling convention this will be 0, for guaranteed tail</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// call conventions it can be positive (a normal return or a tail call to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function that uses less stack space for arguments) or negative (for a tail</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// call to a function that needs more stack space than us for arguments).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This pseudo instruction expands into two mov instructions. If the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// second operand is a symbol reference, this will stay as two wide</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions, movw+movt. If they&#39;re immediates, the first one can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end up as a narrow mov though.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As two SEH instructions are appended here, they won&#39;t get interleaved</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// between the two final movw/movt instructions, but it doesn&#39;t make any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// practical difference.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Emit an instruction sequence that will align the address in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">/// register Reg by zero-ing out the lower bits.  For versions of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">/// architecture that support Neon, this must be done in a single</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction, since skipAlignedDPRCS2Spills assumes it is done in a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">/// single instruction. That function only gets called when optimizing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">/// spilling of D registers on a core with the Neon instruction set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">/// present.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799" lineLink="#a0bd30ba570d7cadf1358f8054ffe4af3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a0bd30ba570d7cadf1358f8054ffe4af3">emitAligningInstructions</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo">ARMFunctionInfo</a> &#42;AFI,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Thumb1 not supported&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if the BFC instruction is available, use that to zero the lower</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bits:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bfc Reg, #0, log2(Alignment)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// otherwise use BIC, if the mask to zero the required number of bits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can be encoded in the bic immediate field</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bic Reg, Reg, Alignment-1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// otherwise, emit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   lsr Reg, Reg, log2(Alignment)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   lsl Reg, Reg, log2(Alignment)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CanUseBFC) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="normal">        .<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder/#a713eab58694282971c413a0d6de5975c">add</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4ad97514ca5a771f28d31ee16af616f8">predOps</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/armcc/#ac8391dd6b8083baa870dee5142ff22b6a8b2ef77967dee1220cc6ee5aee595e11">ARMCC::AL</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We need the offset of the frame pointer relative to other MachineFrameInfo</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="comment">/// offsets which are encoded relative to SP at function begin.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="comment">/// See also emitPrologue() for how the FP is set up.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Unfortunately we cannot determine this value in determineCalleeSaves() yet</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() hasn&#39;t run at this point. Instead we use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this to produce a conservative estimate that we check in an assert() later.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865" lineLink="#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92">getMaxFPOffset</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget">ARMSubtarget</a> &amp;STI, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo">ARMFunctionInfo</a> &amp;AFI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="normal">                          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4b">ARMSubtarget::PushPopSplitVariation</a> PushPopSplit =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="normal">      STI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#aada6bb4af36a2736480f0c51fced2d58">getPushPopSplitVariation</a>(MF);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For Thumb1, push.w isn&#39;t available, so the first push will always push</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// r7 and lr onto the stack first.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (AFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> -AFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#aac9af25844daf41c00656fdfc6770f72">getArgRegsSaveSize</a>() - (2 &#42; 4);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is a conservative estimation: Assume the frame pointer being r7 and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pc(&quot;r15&quot;) up to r8 getting spilled before (= 8 registers).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxRegBytes = 8 &#42; 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (PushPopSplit == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba79139b30a7b6a6caf15fe7c26898cb1c">ARMSubtarget::SplitR11AAPCSSignRA</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here, r11 can be stored below all of r4-r15.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><Highlight kind="normal">    MaxRegBytes = 11 &#42; 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Restore from fp only in ARM mode: e.g. sub sp, r7, #24</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note it&#39;s not safe to do this in Thumb2 mode because it would have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// taken two instructions:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mov sp, r7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sub sp, #24</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If an interrupt is taken between the two instructions, then sp is in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an inconsistent state (pointing to the middle of callee-saved area).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The interrupt handler can end up clobbering the registers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="normal">      AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#aeebbc8bb36d06a4c62b09481cd3d94cb">setShouldRestoreSPFromFP</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set FP to point to the stack slot that contains the previous FP.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For iOS, FP is R7, which has now been stored in spill area 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, if this is not iOS, all the callee-saved registers go</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into spill area 1, including the FP in R11.  In either case, it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1857"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DNum &gt; NumAlignedDPRCS2Regs - 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1858"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1859"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FI = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>.getFrameIdx();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1860"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The even-numbered registers will be 16-byte aligned, the odd-numbered</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1861"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers will be 8-byte aligned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1862"><Highlight kind="normal">    MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#af4c34648ca4596767ff0c3409fc3f2d9">setObjectAlignment</a>(FI, DNum % 2 ? <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(8) : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(16));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1863"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1864"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The stack slot for D8 needs to be maximally aligned because this is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1865"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// actually the point where we align the stack pointer.  MachineFrameInfo</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1866"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computes all offsets relative to the incoming stack pointer which is a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1867"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bit weird when realigning the stack.  Any extra padding for this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1868"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// over-alignment is not realized because the code inserted below adjusts</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1869"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the stack pointer by numregs &#42; 8 before aligning the stack pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1870"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DNum == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1871"><Highlight kind="normal">      MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#af4c34648ca4596767ff0c3409fc3f2d9">setObjectAlignment</a>(FI, MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a3836203fac855ac3c5718b701bd13ffd">getMaxAlign</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1872"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1873"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1874"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Move the stack pointer to the d8 spill slot, and align it at the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1875"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// time. Leave the stack slot address in the scratch register r4.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1876"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1877"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sub r4, sp, #numregs &#42; 8</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1878"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bic r4, r4, #align - 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1879"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   mov sp, r4</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1880"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1881"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armasmprinter-cpp/#ac74d5e6c2cf6e4a41c5cd533e7f88fad">isThumb</a> = AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a6c02973966a15241aedb2a1016de4ff3">isThumbFunction</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1882"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Can&#39;t realign stack for thumb1&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1884"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2563"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!LRSpilled &amp;&amp; AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2564"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FnSize = <a href="#a558790807cf5c060c4c82f09decb89d5">EstimateFunctionSizeInBytes</a>(MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2565"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Force LR to be spilled if the Thumb function size is &gt; 2048 This enables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2567"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (FnSize &gt;= (1 &lt;&lt; 11)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2568"><Highlight kind="normal">      CanEliminateFrame = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2569"><Highlight kind="normal">      ForceLRSpill = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2570"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2571"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2572"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2573"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If any of the stack slot references may be out of range of an immediate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2574"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// offset, make sure a register (or a spill slot) is available for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2575"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register scavenger. Note that if we&#39;re indexing off the frame pointer, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2576"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// effective stack size is 4 bytes larger since the FP points to the stack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2577"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// slot of the previous FP. Also, if we have variable sized objects in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2578"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function, stack slot references will often be negative, and some of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2579"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// our instructions are positive-offset only, so conservatively consider</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2580"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that case to want a spill slot (or register) as well. Similarly, if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2581"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the function adjusts the stack pointer during execution and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2582"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// adjustments aren&#39;t already part of our stack size estimate, our offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2583"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// calculations may be off, so be conservative.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2584"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: We could add logic to be more precise about negative offsets</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2585"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        and which instructions will need a scratch register for them. Is it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2586"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        worth the effort and added fragility?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2587"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EstimatedStackSize =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2588"><Highlight kind="normal">      MFI.estimateStackSize(MF) + 4 &#42; (NumGPRSpills + NumFPRSpills);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2589"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2590"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Determine biggest (positive) SP offset in MachineFrameInfo.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2591"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxFixedOffset = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2592"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = MFI.getObjectIndexBegin(); <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> &lt; 0; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2593"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxObjectOffset = MFI.getObjectOffset(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) + MFI.getObjectSize(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2594"><Highlight kind="normal">    MaxFixedOffset = std::max(MaxFixedOffset, MaxObjectOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2595"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2596"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasFP = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a0c361440fb8d1e36932e65c8cc8497e7">hasFP</a>(MF);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2598"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (HasFP) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2599"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a08384b77b981503bea5f54694d29aef4">hasStackFrame</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2600"><Highlight kind="normal">      EstimatedStackSize += 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2601"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2602"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If FP is not used, SP will be used to access arguments, so count the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2603"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// size of arguments into the estimation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2604"><Highlight kind="normal">    EstimatedStackSize += MaxFixedOffset;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2605"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2606"><Highlight kind="normal">  EstimatedStackSize += 16; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For possible paddings.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2607"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2608"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit, EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2609"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasNonSPFrameIndex = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2610"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2611"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For Thumb1, don&#39;t bother to iterate over the function. The only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2612"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction that requires an emergency spill slot is a store to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2613"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// frame index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2614"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2615"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tSTRspi, which is used for sp-relative accesses, has an 8-bit unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2616"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// immediate. tSTRi, which is used for bp- and fp-relative accesses, has</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2617"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a 5-bit unsigned immediate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2618"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2619"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We could try to check if the function actually contains a tSTRspi</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2620"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that might need the spill slot, but it&#39;s not really important.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2621"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Functions with VLAs or extremely large call frames are rare, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2622"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if a function is allocating more than 1KB of stack, an extra 4-byte</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2623"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// slot probably isn&#39;t relevant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2624"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2625"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A special case is the scenario where r11 is used as FP, where accesses</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2626"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to a frame index will require its value to be moved into a low reg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2627"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is handled later on, once we are able to determine if we have any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2628"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fp-relative accesses.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2629"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasBasePointer(MF))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2630"><Highlight kind="normal">      EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 5) &#42; 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2631"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2632"><Highlight kind="normal">      EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 8) &#42; 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2633"><Highlight kind="normal">    EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 5) &#42; 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2634"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2635"><Highlight kind="normal">    EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2636"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp/#ac3ad986bc12b8c9ef4ebf86b4ed7b3c3">estimateRSStackSizeLimit</a>(MF, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, HasNonSPFrameIndex);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2637"><Highlight kind="normal">    EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit = EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2638"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2639"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Final estimate of whether sp or bp-relative accesses might require</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2640"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scavenging.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2641"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasLargeStack = EstimatedStackSize &gt; EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2702"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3128"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack limit.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3129" lineLink="#ad6f5455eb7ba6ed74cab551099d0a952"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t <a href="#ad6f5455eb7ba6ed74cab551099d0a952">kSplitStackAvailable</a> = 256;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3131"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Adjust the function prologue to enable split stacks. This currently only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3132"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// supports android and linux.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3133"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The ABI of the segmented stack prologue is a little arbitrarily chosen, but</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3135"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// must be well defined in order to allow for consistent implementations of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3136"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#95;&#95;morestack helper function. The ABI is also not a normal ABI in that it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3137"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// doesn&#39;t follow the normal calling conventions because this allows the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3138"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// prologue of each function to be optimized further.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3139"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3140"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently, the ABI looks like (when calling &#95;&#95;morestack)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#42; r4 holds the minimum stack size requested for this function call</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3143"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#42; r5 holds the stack size of the arguments to the function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3144"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#42; the beginning of the function is 3 instructions after the call to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#95;&#95;morestack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3146"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Implementations of &#95;&#95;morestack should use r4 to allocate a new stack, r5 to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// place the arguments on to the new stack, and the 3-instruction knowledge to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// jump directly to the body of the function when working on the new stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3150"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3151"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An old (and possibly no longer compatible) implementation of &#95;&#95;morestack for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3152"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ARM can be found at &#91;1&#93;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3153"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;1&#93; - https://github.com/mozilla/rust/blob/86efd9/src/rt/arch/arm/morestack.S</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
